questions.question: I met ........................... at the park.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: We all looked up to ................................
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I don't know if ............................... am doing the right thing.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form. Subject pronouns are: I, we, you, he, she, they

questions.question: It has been a long time since we heard anything from ..................................
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: Do you know who ............................... is?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form. Subject pronouns are: I, we, you, he, she, they

questions.question: It took .................................. an hour to get dressed.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: We have been waiting for ................................. for a while.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: You have never offered .................................. any help.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: Between you and .................................., I don't want a third person.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: She doesn't smoke like .....................................
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb or a preposition should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, us, me, them, you.

questions.question: Most of our neighbours are richer than .......................................
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.

questions.question: They are more excited than ……………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.
